directions: Melt 1 cup butter. Add icing sugar, peanut butter, and graham crumbs. Stir to combine. Pack into a 9x13 pan.

Melt remaining 1/4 cup butter in a microwave safe bowl. Add chocolate chips and shortening or peanut butter. Microwave for 20 seconds at a time, stirring until melted and smooth. Pour and spread over base.
Chill 2-4 hours. Cut into bars and serve. Store in refrigerator 1 week or longer.

title: peanut butter cup and pretzel stuffed cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Move rack to the middle of the oven. Line cookie sheet with parchment.
Mix peanut butter and sugars until well blended. Crack egg in a small bowl and beat. Mix into the peanut butter mixture. Sprinkle flour, salt and baking powder over top and mix in.

Take 1 teaspoon of dough and flatten out in your hand. Place 1 pretzel, then a peanut butter cup, and then top it off with another pretzel. Then fold up the sides of your cookie dough. It won't cover your entire sandwich. Now take another teaspoon of dough and cover the top of your cookie. Make sure all your seams are closed. Place on baking sheet about 2 inches apart.
Bake 8-10 minutes. Do not overbake.
Enjoy!

title: peanut butter crunchies
directions: 1. Melt peanut butter and butterscotch chips in a microwave in 30-second intervals and stir. This should take approximately 2 minutes to melt. Be careful because it can scorch easily!
2. Add cereal and raisins. Stir until coated.
3. Drop by spoonfuls on a cookie sheet lined with waxed or parchment paper.
4. Chill in the refrigerator until set.
5. Serve! Store in the refrigerator.

title: peanut butter crunch overnight oats
directions: The night before, in a microwave safe bowl, add instant oats and water. Stir to mix. Microwave 1 minute.

In a clean Mason jar or other container of your choice, transfer the microwaved instant oats. Add the Greek yogurt on top, then add the cereal, honey and cinnamon. Cover with plastic wrap (or lid) and refrigerate until morning.
Grab the jar and go! Delicious! Enjoy.

title: peanut butter cornflake chewies
directions: Mix sugar and syrup in a saucepan. Bring to a boil.
Remove from heat and add peanut butter. Stir until blended. Add cornflakes and mix together gently.
Spoon onto a foil-lined cookie sheet sprayed with non-stick spray (about golf ball sized).

title: peanut butter cookies with oatmeal and reese’s
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

In a bowl, beat the sugar and peanut butter together until creamy. Add your eggs and vanilla extract and beat until combined. Add your flour, oats, baking soda and salt and beat until combined.Stir in your Reese's Pieces.
Place a tablespoonful (I used half a cookie scoop) of cookie batter onto the baking sheet and sprinkle with sugar. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes.
Makes 18 cookies.
Calories per cookie: 75, Fat: 3.6, Sodium: 58, Potassium: 41, Carbs: 8.3, Fiber: .8, Sugar: 5.1, Protein: 2.3
(Recipe adapted from Healthy Food for Living.)

title: peanut butter cookies with flax seeds and chocolate
directions: Preheat oven to 325°F. Grease two baking sheets.
Set your stand mixer on medium speed and combine sugar, salt, egg and peanut butter. Add vanilla, flaxseeds and chocolate. Mix until smooth.
Roll the dough into 24 small balls and place them on baking sheets. Using a fork, flatten the balls into cookie-sized formations.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and leave to rest for ten minutes before transferring the cookies onto a cooling rack.
Serve with a tall cool glass of milk.

title: peanut butter cookies (vegan)
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F.
In a medium mixing bowl combine the flour, baking soda, and salt. In a separate larger bowl combine the peanut butter, maple syrup, olive oil, and vanilla.
Pour the flour mixture over the peanut butter mixture and stir until barely combined. Let the mixture sit for five minutes then give it one more quick stir (just a stroke or two).

Now drop the dough by heaping tablespoonfuls onto parchment-lined baking sheets, spacing them a couple inches apart. Press down on each one gently with the back of a fork. (Note: this is a loose batter, so if you're set on doing criss-crosses on the top of each cookie you should chill the batter for an hour or so before this step.)

Bake for 10-11 minutes, but keep and eye on them and don't over bake or they will be dry. Remove pans from oven and set them on a rack. Let cookies cool on the pan for five minutes and transfer to a cooling rack.
Adapted from 101cookbooks.
